H0.text: Intestines are the body part directly affected by a disease that can result from eating undercooked food and affects the digestive system.

H1.text: Arteries are the body part directly affected by a digestiveâ€‘system disease that can result from eating undercooked food.

H2.text: Nerves are the body part directly affected by the disease that can result from eating undercooked food and affect the digestive system.

H3.text: Sinuses are the body part directly affected by the disease that can arise from eating undercooked food, a disease that otherwise affects the digestive system.

A4.text: Various pathogens, such as bacteria that cause foodborne illnesses, can induce gastroenteritis which results from inflammation of the stomach and small intestine.
